pull.title: doc: Remove travis badge from readme
pull.body: The readme(s) are shipped in the released source-code archive, in which case the travis badge is useless since it doesn't link to the travis result of the correct commit/tag/branch. GitHub embeds the correct links for each tag or commit that ci ran on, so we don't need this link in the readme.

events.message: doc: Remove travis badge from readme

events.body:
ACK e91f0a7af2aec7d924f00da25c69d8f46e0dd33d
I have reviewed docs and comments changes and they look OK, I agree they can be merged.

if you wanted to keep the badge in the readme, you could alternatively fix the img link as part of the branch/release process, since
```
https://api.travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin.svg?branch=0.18
```
and
```
https://api.travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin.svg?tag=v0.18.0
```
seem to work as expected

Post-merge ACK

I understand it's only docs, but 4 hours between opening and merging (author and merger being the same person) sets a bad precedent, IMO.
